Join our Webmaker Mentor email list: Join our Webmaker Mentor email list to stay up to date on key news and announcements.
Mozillaian like you: With support from our wonderful partners and Mozillians like you!
teachtemplateHelpCopy: Need help? Check out our Top Tips for creating great teaching resources.
maker-story-translate: Together we're translating Webmaker into every language on the planet.
vdo-profile: a video profile to introduce yourself to the world
browserUpgradeWarning: Your browser may lack functionality needed by Webmaker to function properly. Please upgrade your browser for an improved experience.
Send me email updates: Send me email updates about Mozilla Webmaker and other projects
We provide starter projects: We provide starter projects, templates and event guides to inspire teachers and learners at every level to create on the web and share their knowledge with others.
Get Involved Desc: Access support and connect with the Webmaker community.
We're techies: We're techies, makers, educators, parents and other passionate people who care about creating a more web literate world. We support learners everywhere: in our homes, offices, neighbourhoods, classrooms and online. We believe making something you love — online or off — is the best way to learn
Learning through making: Learning through making is a core part of Mozilla's mission.
Shower your volunteer with love and Mozi: Shower your volunteer with love and Mozilla gear. Big thanks to them (and you) for helping us make Webmaker better for everyone.
About Emma: Emma ran a hack jam for 10-12 year olds at her local university computer lab in Victoria, Canada. Now she’s working with other mentors to launch #GenOpen, one of the world’s first open source projects run by and for youth.
We are always thrilled to hear from user: We are always thrilled to hear from users! Here’s a long list of bugs captured at a Mozilla workshop.
a funny remix of your best friend's favo: a funny remix of your best friend's favourite site
Webmaker mentors get access: Webmaker mentors get access to coveted Mozilla gear like stickers, t-shirts and banners to excite learners and make events even more awesome. Get in touch to learn more.
maker-story-amy: Let’s foster lovely experiences and impromptu creativity on a global scale. Dare to make and share!
4 hours, 2 weeks: 4 hours or longer, 2 weeks of preparation needed
PartyDontKnowDesc2: Or following one of these easy activity kits:
toolsXrayDesc: X-Ray Goggles allow you to see the building blocks that make up websites on the internet. Activate the goggles to inspect the code behind any webpage, then remix elements with a single click, swapping in your own text, images and more.
PartyDontKnowHeader: Don't know where to start making or teaching?
Familiarize yourself with our survey: Familiarize yourself with our survey.
Learn and teach new hacking skills: Learn and teach new hacking skills
Team up to explore: Team up people with different skill-sets to explore an interesting challenge
Say hello on a Webmaker cummunity call: Say hello on a Webmaker Community call.
see how it works: We've built everything so you can see how it works, take it apart and remix it.
Are you sure you want to delete this mak: Are you sure you want to delete this make?
Hosting Webmaker events: Hosting Webmaker events to share your knowledge both in-person and online.
Make somethingPartyPage: Events are always happening. See what is going on near you.
eventHeader: Want to make the web with others?
This is the G+ community: This is the G+ community for anyone interested in teaching the web. Take part in discussions, find useful resources, and see what other people are making and learning.
Hang out as a family on the computer: Hang out as a family on the computer
We recognize that innovation can come fr: We recognize that innovation can come from anyone, anywhere so we bring together people with diverse skills and backgrounds — teachers, filmmakers, journalists, hackers, youth, artists, scientists policy-makers and more — to collaborate online and at events around the globe.
About Us Desc: Learn more about who we are and what makes us tick.
mobile unsupport: Hey, just so you know, this site isn't fully functional on mobile.
A global community that wants: A global community that wants to teach the web right is creating a Web Literacy Standard. We're trying to build consensus around the skills, competencies and literacies necessary to read, write and participate on the web - now and in the future.
teachBanner: Join us! Become a Mozilla Webmaker Mentor and help learners around the world level up their skills. It’s all part of our non-profit mission to spread web skills and digital creativity for all.
Contribute code paragraph: All Webmaker tools are open source. Contribute ideas, patches, bugs or your own demos and prototypes. Access documentation, issue trackers and more.
Next step help: Looking for help on next steps? Check out our handy
Teach the web paragraph: You don’t need to be a wizard to teach the web. We've created hackable guides for teaching web literacy, webmaking, online storytelling and more. Want to create your own lesson plan? We have great templates for that.
Host a user testing paragraph: A user testing session is when you sit down with a user, have them explore the site and then fill out a survey with their responses. These sessions are extremely helpful to us because users can concentrate on exploring the site while you take care of accurately reporting on their experience.
join-cta: Join others at a local event or Maker Party – or collaborate online
Num of Attendees expected: How many attendees are you expecting?
front-page-description: We're a global community dedicated to teaching digital skills and web literacy. We explore, tinker and create together to build a web that's open and made by everyone.
Spend an hour on a rainy day: Spend an hour on a rainy day
Mozilla's annual Maker Party: Mozilla's annual Maker Party and the Mozilla Festival attract thousands of eager learners, not to mention filmmakers, journalists, politicians, artists and inventors.
Become a mentor paragraph: Mentoring is a chance to share your knowledge and provide feedback directly to learners of all ages around the world who are hungry for digital skills.
how are we doing sub: Receiving your opinions on the Webmaker experience is really important to us. In fact, your feedback is pretty much the first thing we take into account when we plan future impovements to the site. Please take a minute to tell us what you like about the site, what doesn't work how you expected it would and what could be better.
A Hive Pop-Up is fantastic way to:: A Hive Pop-Up is a fantastic way to:
join-cta-bullet-1: Find an event or maker party near you.
join-cta-bullet-2: Host your own event. Our guides make it easy.
join-cta-bullet-3: Teach and learn with others online using Webmaker's new Together.js (coming soon)
OFOReportDesc: Tell us how your event went by remixing this report-back template.
Join our community call: Join our community calls every Tuesday. All are welcome! Ask questions, meet our community and staff and find the resources you need.
start-making-desc: Webmaker tools  make it easy to learn web skills through making. Dive into one of these community projects to get started
teachtemplateKitDesc: Create a lesson plan or session outline
PlanningAnEvent: Planning an event? Let us help!
Community center, library, school: In an open space like a community centre, library or school
Submit a bug for Popcorn Maker: Submit a bug for Popcorn Maker
Contribute a guide or resource paragraph: Do you have a web literacy project? We'd love to hear about it and potentially share it on Webmaker.org.
Use our Tools Desc: Create an original or a remix using Popcorn Maker and Thimble.
active daily discussion paragraph: This is a more active daily discussion where you can help shape the direction of the Webmaker project.
OFOOrderDesc: Place your gear order to receive t-shirts, stickers and banners.
9 Ways to get Involved parapgraph: Mozilla Webmaker creates software, projects and events that promote digital literacy through making and sharing. We're an open source project powered by makers, mentors and community leaders. We'd love you to get involved.
Receive occasional email paragraph: Receive occasional email updates only about the most important stuff — about once a month.
an online poster for your favourite movi: an online poster for your favourite movie
A Hack Jam is a great way to: A Hack Jam is a great way to:
Make something paragraph: Making is the basis of everything we do. Try remixing one of our starter makes, or make something from scratch using X-Ray Goggles, Thimble, or Popcorn Maker. Then share it with the world using hashtag #webmaker.
DetailsShareTwitterMsg: Check out this awesome project from Webmaker.org:
teachDesc: We've got creative ways to help anyone teach web literacy, digital skills and making. Use our free tools, activities and lesson plans. Or make your own – with help from our global community of educators, techies and mentors like you.
Become a Mentor Desc: Provide direct feedback to learners of any age from around the world
Donate to Webmaker paragraph: As a non-profit organization, we depend on the generosity of people like you to fund our goal of encouraging millions of people around the world to move beyond using the web to making it.
Confirm event deletion: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this event?
maker-story-yoe: I love sharing knowledge and skills.
Amy Burvall: Amy Burvall, Webmaker Fellow, teacher and remix artist
PartyPartnersDesc: Interested in being a Maker Party Partner and want more information? Send us an email at makerparty@mozillafoundation.org.
when we understand the building blocks: After all, it's only when we understand the building blocks of the web that we can have a hand in shaping its future.
Make cool things on the web: Make cool things on the web

encourage millions of people: encourage millions of people around the world to move beyond using the web to making it.
Creating and sharing resources: Creating and sharing resources like teaching guides, kits and activities with other techies and educators.

toolsHeader: Create and remix the web with Webmaker tools.

Advertize your event: Tell people a few more details about your event. What can they expect?
teachtemplateDesc: Create an entire lesson plan – or just a bite-sized individual activity, then share them with other educators and mentors around the world.
starterMakesDesc: Want to get started, but don't know what to make yet? Here are some projects you can remix now!
Sign up for Webmaker announcement list: Sign up for the Webmaker announcement list.
Webmaker's mentor community: Webmaker's mentor community spans the entire globe. Connect with other techies, educators and mentors to exchange ideas and creative new ways for teaching technology.
Home, cafe, library: At home, in a cafe or at the library

indexDesc: We're a global community that creates the web by making, teaching and remixing. Check out this week's most inspiring Makes and sign up to create your own.
Hive NYC Storymakers, Brooklyn Public Li: Hive NYC Storymakers, Brooklyn Public Library
Webmaker mentors are defining the future: Webmaker mentors are defining the future of education and technology with innovative new pedagogies and interest-driven, learner-centered content.
an alternate version of a controversial: an alternate version of a controversial webpage
9 Ways to Get Involved with Webmaker: 9 Ways to Get Involved with Webmaker
School, library: At a school, library or flexible space
maker-story-brooklyn: We remixed our favorite stories using digital media and the web.
toolsPMDesc: Popcorn Maker helps you easily remix web video, audio and images into cool mashups that you can embed on other websites. Drag and drop content from the web, then add your own comments and links —all within your browser. Popcorn Maker videos are dynamic, full of links and unique with every view.
Sign up for your Webmaker account.
OFOStartHereDesc: Begin by reading our Get Involved wiki.
Find or host an event paragraph: From hack jams to pop ups to the global Maker Party, there's an event to suit every interest. Search for one near you or host your own — we have guides to show you how.
Bring together local organizations: Bring together local organizations in a science fair setting
Our team uses an issue tracker: Our team uses an issue tracker called Bugzilla for filing bugs and monitoring fixes.
OFOShareDesc: During your event, ask participants to share what they make using this template.
Event added: Thank you! Your event has been added.
If you don’t see the Whiteboard field: If you don’t see the Whiteboard field, make sure the advanced options are showing.
OFOPhotoDesc: We love photos! Share pictures of your event by emailing us.
toolsThimbleDesc: Thimble makes it ridiculously simple to create and share your own web pages. Write and edit HTML and CSS right in your browser, then instantly preview your work. Host and share your finished projects with a single click. Perfect for beginners and experts alike.
PlanningAnEventDesc: This section provides an overview of important links and to-dos for your event. Don't forget to order free Webmaker gear for your party.
From coding your first line of HTML to b: Events are happening all around the world from workshops, design sprints and code-a-thons to teen tech bashes and father-daughter hack jams. Find a party near you using our global events map.
Show Off Your Work: Can't find an event? Host your own using our guides!
Make something amazing on the web: Thank you for joining our global party and making something amazing on the web
About Unnati: Unnati participated in our Summer Code Party in 2012 where she learned to remix her own web pages using Thimble and Popcorn. She now shares her knowledge by teaching her friends, family and classmates basic HTML.
Find a willing volunteer: Find a willing volunteer and walk them through our survey. Let them drive, but ask them to speak their thoughts aloud so you can write them in the form.
maker-story-manilla: I hosted an all-girl Maker Party where women can learn how to teach the wonders of the web.
No makes found. Did you mean to search by title?
Mentor an eager learner paragraph: As part of Mozilla’s non-profit mission, our goal is to spread digital literacy and skills through open collaboration. Mentoring is key to accomplishing this on a global scale. Webmaker mentors help others learn digital skills and share creative new ways for teaching technology.
learn-cta-bullet-3: See what others are making. More than projects shared!
learn-cta-bullet-2: starts from scratch. Make your own web page, interactive video or remix.
Connect through social media: Connect through social media and see what people are making, follow events from around the world and check out new Webmaker projects by visiting our Tumblr, Twitter, Facebook, Flickr, YouTube and our blog.
Joining our weekly community calls: Joining our weekly community calls to connect with mentoring community.
When you file your bug: When you file your bug, be sure to put "Feedback" in the Status Whiteboard field so we can find it. If you don’t see the Whiteboard option, make sure the advanced options are showing.
Log in to like: Please log in to Webmaker to show some love!
teach-cta: Teach the web with interactive tools, activities and lessons plans that are free, hackable and fun
eventDesc: We've got guides to help you plan. What are you in the mood to try?
OFOAddEventDesc: Add your event to our global event map.
bug doesn’t necessarily mean there’s som: And just because it’s called a "bug" doesn’t necessarily mean there’s something wrong; it can be an idea you have for a feature, a note about how much you like something or a non-technical suggestion for improvments.
a custom homepage for the New York Times: a custom homepage for the New York Times
EEVR warning: This link will take you to an external event registration service, such as Eventbrite.
teachtemplateHeader: Make and share your own kits for teaching the web.
From newsletters to community calls: From newsletters to community calls, there are many ways you can join our community.
PartyDontForgetLearn2Tag: Learn how to tag on Webmaker
Mentors help others learn: Mentors help others learn digital skills by providing direct feedback to learners of any age from around the world. There is no formal application or process to become a webmaking mentor. Instead, we invite you to simply get involved by:
Tag your work with #makerparty: You don't have to have to be a pro to host your own party. From groups of two to groups of hundreds, we have guides to help you plan for events where you can teach or learn with your peers. Don't forget to add your event to the map and share details with us along the way.
Fill out our survey paragraph: We've put together a detailed survey so you can let us know why you're happy, confused or even...(gulp)...angry with our site. This survey will take about 20 minutes to complete but we'll send you a free Webmaker t-shirt when you're done! Everyone is welcome to complete the survey – even if you're brand new to Webmaker.
Maker Party is a part of the MacArthur: Maker Party is a part of the MacArthur Foundation's Make Summer campaign.
Events Desc: Find an event near you or host your own.
Teach Desc: Teach the world web literacy and webmaking.
Our tools, events and teaching guides: Our tools, events and teaching guides allow webmakers to not only create the content that makes the web great, but — perhaps more importantly — understand how the web works.
A Kitchen Party is a fun way to: A Kitchen Party is a fun way to:
PartyDontForgetDesc: Tag your work with #makerparty and inspire others. Share your knowledge, show off your creation and feel the love from the Webmaker community.
Creating the web is the heart of our wor: Creating the web is the heart of our work. We build tools like Thimble, X-Ray Goggles and Popcorn Maker that allow people to create amazing content while peeking under the hood of the internet, getting familiar with all the moving parts and getting their hands dirty with foundational elements like HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
The fastest way to get help: The fastest way to get help, offer help and connect with other mentors.
maker-story-india: I went to teach, but in the end I learned a lot.
We consider digital literacy: We consider digital literacy a critical skill just like reading, writing and math.
Welcome to Webmaker-Mozilla: Welcome to Webmaker — a Mozilla project dedicated to helping you create something amazing on the web.
From June 15 to September 15: From June 15 to September 15, nearly 60,000 people around the world met up, shared their skills and made amazing things on the web at the 2013 Maker Party. Thank you to the thousands of teachers, learners, friends, families and organizations across the globe who united to celebrate what we can make (and break!) on the web. Read about the success of Maker Party 2013.
teach-cta-bullet-4: Join our global community of mentors, educators and makers.
teach-cta-bullet-2: Create and share your own teaching kit.
teach-cta-bullet-3: Explore Mozilla's new Web Literacy Standard.
teach-cta-bullet-1: Use our activities, teaching guides and curriculum. They're free, hackable and fun!
Collaboratively build or improve: Collaboratively build something new or improve something that already exists
privacy-desc: I'm okay with you handling this info as you explain in your
Maker Party Desc: From now to September 15, join other webmakers in a global Maker Party.
learn-cta: Learn web skills by making, breaking and mashing up the unexpected
maker-story-mit: Webmaker shows how malleable and sharable the web is – helping people not only use tech, but also become creators of it.
We're a big community and we connect in many ways.
Video remixing and open source for youth: Video remixing and open source for youth
OFOContactDesc: Still have questions? Email us at makerparty@mozilla.org
Visit our communications wiki: Visit our communications wiki to find even more places you can reach us.
participate in user testing paragraph: Participate in user testing, give feedback, or help with QA. Your testing and ideas will make Mozilla Webmaker products better and help shape their future.
The worldwide Maker Party will bring peo: From coding your first line of HTML to building innovative apps, Maker Party is your chance to connect with a global community of creators. The easiest way to join the party is to build something yourself! Take a project from scratch or remix a project and make it your own.
With this knowledge: With this knowledge, we can make a web without limits. That's the philosophy behind webmaker.org.
About Jon: Jon organized a 48-hour hack jam in Dundee, Scotland, exploring everything from a “Twitter bird” made out of paper and wire to hooking Google Maps up to an arcade joystick.
PartyDontKnowDesc: Why not try following the easy steps and remixing one of these makes below.
Engage by title: Use an awesome title so people will come!
OFOAddEvent: Add your event to the map
new Webmaker tools and projects: Be the first to try out new Webmaker tools and projects.
